agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing support and educational services for current and former inmates.
service_description: Provides support groups, educational classes, and community events for those seeking recovery. Services jointly offered with Milford Methodist Meeting House.
site_details: Visit website to complete online Let's Chat form, send email or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: Provides preventive healthcare programs to the community through education, advocacy, physician referrals, research, and the building of leadership among Hispanics, so that they may lead healthier lifestyles.
site_name: NORTHERN INDIANA HISPANIC HEALTH COALITION - WARSAW
service_description: Provides an online bilingual directory of medical and human service resources. Resources and referrals are also available by phone. Limited service area.
site_details: Call for information, resources, and referrals, or visit the website to view the resource directory.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Offers immediate care for minor injuries and illness, including sore throats, ear infections, colds, flu, pink eye, asthma, sinus infections, allergies, and rashes. X-rays and labs NOT are available at this location.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call or send an email to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry, including a clothing pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food, frozen food, produce, and meat to persons in need. Limited services area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not received assistance from this pantry in the past 30 days

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Provides language instruction and civics education, taught at various levels, for beginning and intermediate English speakers. Enrollment is available during the academic school year and takes place in the evening.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or visit website for information.
site_eligibility: Beginning to intermediate level English speakers -- Age 18 or older

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF KOSCIUSKO COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF KOSCIUSKO COUNTY
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low-income persons. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor (sweat equity) toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application.
site_eligibility: Living in Kosciusko County for at least 1 full year -- Household income between 30%-60% of area median (Call or see website or call for current amounts.) -- Stable employment or other source of income for at least one year -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: A nonprofit youth organization that provides enrichment services through recreational and educational activities for youth.
service_description: Offers an after-school enrichment program for youth within Kosciusko County that focuses on healthy life choices and academics. Services may include homework help, sports and fitness, and other recreational activities. Dinner and snack are provided during the school year and lunch in the summer. Some transportation may be available during the school year to and from satellite locations.
site_details: Visit website to register, or call for information.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7am-5pm -- Before School Program: Mon-Fri 6:30am -- After School Program: Mon-Thurs 3pm-6:30pm and Fri 3pm-6pm -- Summer Session: Mon-Fri 7am-5:30pm
site_eligibility: Grades K-12

agency_desc: A nonprofit orgnanization that provides temporary shelter for individuals and families who are victims of domestic violence, along with outreach services to help transition to violence-free life style.
service_description: Provides emergency shelter for persons or families who are fleeing a domestic violence situation. Secure accommodations are available, as well as support services including counseling, advocacy, safety planning, continuing education, and transitional housing opportunities.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to complete an intake assessment.
site_eligibility: Victims of domestic violence (men, women, and children)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that connects people to human services, makes health related referrals, and provides financial assistance for medical needs.
service_description: Provides help paying for a medical visit or existing medical bills that are not in the collection process. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment to apply.
site_eligibility: Uninsured or under-insured -- Unable to pay for medical visit or bill

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Winona Lake in Kosciusko County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Winona Lake in Kosciusko County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Winona Lake in Kosciusko County

agency_desc: A nonprofit that provides case management helping students fulfill their duties as parents and students.
service_description: Provides parenting support and education, as well as case management, to enable pregnant and parenting teens to continue their education. Child care is provided on site for program participants. Services may continue up until the student's second year in college.
taxonomy_name: School Based Teen Parent/Pregnant Teen Programs
nameLevel3: School Based Teen Parent/Pregnant Teen Programs
site_details: Call the office to schedule an interview prior to enrollment. Must complete application.
site_eligibility: Attending a school in Wawasee Community School Corporation* Pregnant or parenting teen-agers -- Not yet completed two years of college after graduating high school

service_description: Provides nonperishable and perishable food to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Open service area.
site_details: Drive around to the back of the church; Walk in and be prepared to provide name, address, and how many in the household.

service_description: Provides nonperishable food, meat, hygiene products, clothing, baby food, baby cereal, diapers, and milk vouchers for persons in need. Limited service area.

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization that provides a variety of services for those in need, including a food pantry.
service_description: Offers emergency assistance to individuals and families in need up to $150. Applicants are required to attend budgeting class.  Limited funds available.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Kosciusko County -- Not more than 1 month behind in rent

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Kosciusko County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Call for information.
site_schedule: Child Support Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
Child Support Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Kosciusko  County, and the city of Goshen in Elkhart County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in these areas are currently OPEN. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Walk in to pick up an application for the wait list. -- No emergency housing is available. Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: Household income below set limits

agency_name: LIFE TOUCH MINISTRIES AND COUNSELING CENTER
agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization offering counseling to individuals, couples, and families.
site_name: LIFE TOUCH MINISTRIES AND COUNSELING CENTER
service_description: Provides faith-based counseling for children and adults in need. Counseling for areas including, but not limited to grief, depression, parenting, pregnancy, marriage, family relationships, personal growth, and substance abuse.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call, walk in, or send an email to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Kosciusko County.
service_name: TRAINING - COMMUNITY EMERGENCY RESPONSE TEAM TRAINING
service_description: Offers training to prepare volunteers in Kosciusko County to help themselves and others in the event of a disaster until trained emergency personnel arrive. Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) volunteers provide support by giving immediate assistance to victims, providing damage assessment information, and organizing other volunteers at a disaster site.
site_details: Call or visit the website to sign up for training or for more information.
site_schedule: Office Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm --  After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Office Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm --  After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Office Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm --  After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Office Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm --  After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
Office Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm --  After-hours Emergencies: On call, daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Persons who live or work in Kosciusko County

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Kosciusko County.
site_name: KOSCIUSKO COUNTY EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT - COUNTY HIGHWAY GARAGE
service_description: Offers empty bags to be filled with sand to prevent flood damage. This garage is unstaffed; persons will need to be prepared to fill bags with sand.
site_details: Walk in to fill sand bags with sand.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization striving to meet the needs of and improve services to seniors.
service_description: Provides one hot meal each weekday for home bound, local area seniors. Special diets are available.
site_details: Call to apply.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -- Home bound -- Physician must verify that the person is unable to reasonably prepare food themselves

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers literacy education to adults, in conjunction with Warsaw Community Schools, to prepare for secondary or post-secondary education.
service_description: Offers literacy instruction to adults, living in Kosciusko County, who want to improve their reading skills. Participants must read below a high school level. Classroom and individual tutoring is available in preparation of the high school equivalency testing.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake assessment and placement testing.
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- No longer enrolled in school

agency_desc: A nonprofit providing various programs to assist uninsured or underinsured, low-income residents of Kosciusko County with prescription medication and dental care.
service_description: Provides a voucher to pay for dental care for eligible children living in Kosciusko County. The voucher covers the cost of visits to participating dentists for an exam, hygiene education, and any follow-up treatment needed for good dental health.
site_details: Walk in to meet with a Patient Advocate.
site_eligibility: Children in 3rd grade or younger (child does not have to be in school to qualify) -- Eligible for free or reduced lunch -OR - at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A commercial hospital, that offers emergency, inpatient, and outpatient medical care.
service_description: Offers a monthly support group for diabetes patients and their loved ones. Topics include meal planning, medication management, exercise, and lifestyle issues.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.  No registration needed. -- To make an appointment regarding diabetes, call Centralized Scheduling
site_eligibility: People who have diabetes and their friends and families

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering local transit for Kosciusko County residents, and a Healthy Families program.
service_description: Provides curb-to-curb public transportation by appointment within Kosciusko County. Medicaid-approved and can transport to medical appointments state-wide. All vans are wheelchair accessible.
site_details: Call or send email 24 hours in advance to schedule a reservation.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Warsaw in Kosciusko County.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Warsaw in Kosciusko County.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Warsaw in Kosciusko County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Warsaw in Kosciusko County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Warsaw in Kosciusko County.
site_name: WARSAW PUBLIC WORKS AND STREET DEPARTMENT
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, trash services, yard waste recycling, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Warsaw in Kosciusko County.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Warsaw in Kosciusko County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Kosciusko County.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in Kosciusko County, responds to animal-related emergencies, and impounds stray domestic animals. County Dispatch takes information on lost and found animals.
site_details: Call to make an animal-related report or lost and found inquiry.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that serves homeless men, women and children in need of shelter.
service_description: Provides shelter for homeless individuals and families in need. Services are offered to help residents find permanent housing, employment, and to gain self-sufficiency. Warrant checks are required for admission. Length of stay varies case by case.
site_details: Call or walk in to check availability and verify warrant check.
site_eligibility: Homeless -- Single adults -OR- families with children -- Willing to submit to a warrant check

agency_desc: Provides planning, zoning, permitting, and flood control regulations in the unincorporated areas of the county as well as for the towns of Syracuse, Milford, North Webster, Pierceton, Claypool, Silver Lake, Burket, and Etna Green
service_description: Enforces zoning ordinances and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals and administers subdivision and flood control ordinances in the county outside of the Warsaw city limits in Kosciusko County. This department issues permits for construction projects, and advises the planning commission and other legislative bodies as to zoning rules and regulations.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Open; services limited to Kosciusko County outside the Warsaw city limits

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Kosciusko County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Kosciukso County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Kosciusko County

agency_name: ANIMAL WELFARE LEAGUE OF KOSCIUSKO COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit animal resource center providing care until placed in a loving home.
site_name: ANIMAL WELFARE LEAGUE OF KOSCIUSKO COUNTY
service_description: Accepts donations of pet food and supplies for shelter use. Needed items often include pet food, trash bags, copy paper, liquid soap, toiletries, and cleaning supplies. Volunteers are needed to assist with shelter duties, including yard work, facility maintenance, dog walking, and fundraising.
site_details: Call or send email to request an application.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Age 15-17: Must have parental consent

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Kosciusko County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance or visit website for meeting information. Meeting is held on the third floor.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Every other Tues 9am
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Every other Tues 9am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_name: KOSCIUSKO COUNTY HEAD START/EARLY HEAD START
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides comprehensive health, social services and education programming to pregnant women, infants, children and their families.
site_name: KOSCIUSKO COUNTY HEAD START/EARLY HEAD START
service_description: Provides prenatal and early childhood support through a home-based program that combines parenting education, economic self-sufficiency planning, and health and social services for low-income families.
site_details: Walk in, call, or visit the website for enrollment information.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and mothers with children up to age 3 -- Household income at or below 100% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A not-for-profit corporation working to preserve the agricultural heritage of Kosciusko County through various partnerships and community events including the county fair.
service_description: Offers a county fair annually, with entertainment including rides, games, information booths, music, food vendors, and animal demonstrations. Other events held throughout the year.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides electric service to customers in Kosciusko County and portions of Fulton, Wabash, and Whitley County.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in Kosciusko County and portions of Fulton, Wabash, and Whitley County.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a 24-hour, automated kiosk, and a drop box are available at this location.
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Fulton, Kosciusko, Wabash, and Whitley County

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food, hygiene supplies, and paper products to persons in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services to families and youth.
service_description: Provides an evidence-based program for families with youth ages 6-16 years-old to develop a positive living environment and enhance family relationships. The program includes family activities that improve communication, effective discipline techniques, and dealing with stress and peer pressure. Also, meals are shared with the families during meetings.
site_details: Call or email Mandy Bailey for information or to enroll.
site_eligibility: Parents or caregivers with youth age 6-16 years-old -- Able to commit to 14 sessions

agency_desc: A faith-based, rehabilitation program, servicing women ages 18 and older who struggle with drug and alcohol dependency.
service_description: Provides a faith-based residential housing program for women with substance abuse issues. Clients work with a case manager to address personal and program goals and participate in individual and group counseling, community projects, Bible study, budgeting/finance classes, parenting classes, and to establish self-sufficiency and practical life skills. Length of program is 12-18 months requiring a minimum commitment of 1 year.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for an application.
site_eligibility: Women with substance abuse issues -- Age 18 or older -- Able to test clean upon program entry --Submit to a background check -- Nonsmoking -- Not pregnant -- Commit to the required program rules and time

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services for county roadways in Kosciusko County.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Kosciusko County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Kosciusko County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides counseling that focuses on mental, and emotional health such as but not limited to grief, anxiety, autism, substance abuse, and marital issues.
service_description: Agency provides counseling for various types of issues such as depression, anxiety, marital issues or divorce, codependency, grief, personality, mood or psychiatric disorders, play therapy, and spiritual counseling.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers counseling, tutoring, including animal care.
service_description: Offers counseling services integrated with therapy animals to children and adults struggling with depression, anxiety, addiction, personality disorder, behavior problems, grief, foster care and adoption issues or other psychiatric and social problems. Services include individual, group, and family counseling; faith-based counseling is optional. Based on the need, support groups may be available. Clients unable to pay for service may contribute volunteer hours on the animal farm; case by case.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides physical, occupational, and speech therapy.
service_description: Provides occupational, physical, and speech therapy for children with or at risk for developmental delays. Offers free developmental screenings for children.
taxonomy_name: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
nameLevel3: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or younger -- With or at risk for a developmental delay -- Must have doctor's prescription for services

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a soup kitchen.
service_description: Offers monthly meal;   all are welcome;   Inside dining with option to come in and take carry out
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Parish Office: Mon-Fri 8am-3pm -- Meal: Monthly 3rd Tues 5:30pm-7pm (excluding Feb and July)
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_name: EARLY START PRENATAL CLINIC/PRENATAL CARE COORDINATION
service_description: Provides an Early-Start Prenatal Clinic and case management services to women expecting a child. Services include parenting education on prenatal and newborn care.Referrals are offered for programs such as Medicaid and Women, Infants, and Children (WIC), physician referral, health care information, prenatal vitamins, and B.A.B.E. Boutique. Presumptive Eligibility applications for Medicaid are completed if eligible, while awaiting approval for benefits. Pregnancy tests are available at this location.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Kosciusko County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information, referral, and testing regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides free pregnancy testing and first trimester ultrasound. Services such as parenting education, incentives for baby supplies, and referrals are also offered.
service_description: Provides a parenting education program with incentives offered at each session. Topics include child care, budgeting, health and safety, discipline, and more. Participants earn coupons which may be used to purchase items such as cribs, car seats, and other new baby supplies in the BABE Boutique.
site_details: Call or text to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women or parent/guardian of a child -- With children age 5 or younger

agency_desc: A multi-purpose youth center with recreational and educational programs.
service_description: Provides a multi-purpose youth center with recreational and educational programs. Activities include various sports, arts and crafts, and leadership development.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Programs: Vary -- Office: Mon-Fri 9am-2:30pm; June-Aug; by appointment
Programs: Vary -- Office: Mon-Fri 9am-2:30pm; June-Aug; by appointment
site_eligibility: Open; Serves grades K-12

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Offers 100 traditional and non-traditional scholarship opportunities to high school students planning on attending college, technical or certificate programs.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Warsaw in Kosciusko County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Warsaw in Kosciusko County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Kosciusko County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Warsaw in Kosciusko County

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit agency that serves the low-income residents of Kosciusko County by providing human services programming.
service_description: Offers short-term mentoring and case management for individuals experiencing obstacles to financial stability. Services may be received for 9 to 12 months. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open to age 18 and older

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for residents of Wayne in Kosciusko County. Circulates books, eBooks, periodicals, audio books, CDs, and DVDs. Provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Wayne Township

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for the residents of Van Buren Township and portions of eastern Jefferson township in Kosciusko County. Circulates books, eBooks, periodicals, audio books, CDs, and DVDs. Provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 10am-8pm; Tues, Wed, and Fri 10am-6pm; Sat 10am-2pm
Mon and Thurs 10am-8pm; Tues, Wed, and Fri 10am-6pm; Sat 10am-2pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living or working in Van Buren Township or portions of eastern Jefferson Township in Kosciusko County.

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Offers services for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.
